title: Quiz 9: Information, Education & Communication (IEC)
description: Evaluate your understanding of IEC strategies, adult learning principles, and conducting health talks.

questions.question: What does the acronym IEC stand for?
questions.explanation: IEC stands for Information, Education and Communication.
questions.hint: Three key components of sharing knowledge.

questions.question: Which of the following are purposes of IEC? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Motivate people to seek health care

questions.explanation: IEC aims to inform, dispel rumours, motivate, and empower. It cannot force change.
questions.hint: IEC is about influence and empowerment.

questions.question: Adults learn faster when the information acquired is of ___BLANK___ use to them.
questions.explanation: Adults are motivated by immediate utility/relevance of information.

questions.question: When teaching a community, you should assume they have no prior knowledge.
questions.explanation: Always assume people have some knowledge, however inaccurate. Start with what they know.

questions.question: Match the communication channel to its type:
questions.explanation: Face-to-face is interpersonal; Broadcast/Print is mass media.

questions.question: Which factors positively influence adult learning? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Adults learn best when they decide to learn, trust the environment, are active, and get feedback.
questions.hint: Conditions that make you want to learn.

questions.question: What is the term for systematic attempts to positively influence attitudes and behavior?
questions.explanation: IEC is the systematic process defined in the text.

questions.question: Why is it important to understand the health problems of your target audience before a talk?

options.text: To identify what materials are needed

questions.explanation: Understanding needs helps identify relevant info, materials, and objectives.
questions.hint: Preparation relies on knowing the problem.

questions.question: Order the steps in preparing for a health talk:
questions.explanation: Assess needs -> Set objectives -> Prepare materials -> Implement.

questions.question: Youth are more influenced by radio/music, while adults prefer discussions.
questions.explanation: Different media influence groups differently; youth like radio/music, adults like interpersonal discussion.
